result.execSummary:
The defendant John W Nendza was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Paid in full with cash bond.
Defendant shall not possess any illegal drugs or substances/drug paraphernalia as defined in Chapter 961.
Defendant shall submit to any assessments and fully participate in any counseling deemed appropriate by the Agent and abide by any treatment recommendations.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. John W Nendza

Celia Jensen

Waupaca County Jail

Defendant John W Nendza appeared in court via video conferencing. 
Assistant District Attorney James Fassbender: Present. 
Defendant was arrested on warrant. 
Defendant is represented by Troy Nielsen, who cannot appear today. 
Statements by defendant, he waives right to counsel. 
Waiver accepted by the Court after rights were explained. 
Defendant enters a plea of no contest to the sole count in the Complaint. 
Plea accepted and defendant found guilty. 
Sentenced to 30 days jail, imposed/stayed, ordered 1 year probation. 
Conditions: 
- pay costs/supervision fees 
- submit to assessments/counseling and abide by recommendations 
- not possess any illegal drugs or substances/drug paraphernalia as defined in Chapter 961 
Appeal rights and other paperwork to be sent to Sheriff Office as defendant is being held on another warrant.
